title: Sri Lanka president will absolutely not resign, says chief govt whip as calls for resignation mount
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa will not step down under any circumstance, chief government whip and Highways Minister Johnston Fernando told parliament on Wednesday (06) even as protestors islandwide continued their demand that Rajapaka “go home”.

“Six point nine million people voted for the president. As a government, we declare that the president will absolutely not resign. We will face this,” thundered Fernando in response to a statement by opposition MP Nalin Bandara.

Thousands of Sri Lankans have been taking to the streets since last Thursday (31) demanding the resignation of President Rajapaksa and his government over its handling of one of the worst economic crises in the island nation’s history.

Forty-two government MPs have declared their intention to function independently in parliament, and opposition parties have rejected an invitation by the president to accept cabinet portfolios and form an interim administration to manage the crisis.
Sri Lanka’s parliament began a two-day debate on Wednesday on the economic crisis and the political crisis it has precipitated. (Colombo/Apr06/2022)
